intro: Lepidium gracile, commonly known as slender wallflower, is a small annual herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and features slender, branching stems covered in small, glandular hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Lepidium gracile is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in dry grasslands.
